text: Wireless Communication
label: HH2

text: Collocation Site Plan
label: HH2

text: Type I Review
label: HH2

text: Handout #74-C Revised: 1/8/09
label: BODY

text: What types of projects are subject to a Type I Review Process?
label: HH3

text: Collocation of wireless communication facilities that are located in Industrial or Forest
label: BODY

text: zone districts in the Rural area or Commercial districts in the Urban Growth Area are
label: BODY

text: subject to Type I Review requirements.  Type I projects are exempt from the State
label: BODY

text: Environmental Policy Act (SEPA) review and subject to clear, objective and non-
label: BODY

text: discretionary standards requiring professional judgement about technical issues.
label: BODY

text: Type I Site Plan reviews are “ministerial”, requiring a review and decision by staff unless
label: BODY

text: they are exempt from the site plan review process.
label: BODY

text: When is a Fire Marshal review required?
label: HH3

text: The following list summarizes when it is necessary for the Fire Marshal’s office to review
label: BODY

text: a project.  A “yes” answer to any one of these questions confirms that a Fire Marshal’s
label: BODY

text: review is necessary.  Note: This review may be required even if Type I Site Plan review
label: BODY

text: is not required.
label: BODY

text: Will there be a change in occupancy or use?
label: BODY

text: Is a building permit required, (other than for a single-family residence or a duplex)?
label: BODY

text: Does the project involve a change in vehicular access to the site?
label: BODY

text: Does the review involve fire flow requirements? For example, will there be an
label: BODY

text: increase in height or interior floor area?
label: BODY

text: Does the review involve other fire protection requirements such as fire sprinkler
label: BODY

text: systems, alarm systems, fire hydrants, etc.?
label: BODY

text: Does the project include new construction involving review of building setbacks?
label: BODY

text: Is the subject site within the Wildland Urban Interface/Intermix Area?
label: BODY

text: Does the review involve any new building construction or review of limitations to a
label: BODY

text: land use?
label: BODY

text: Does the review involve hazardous processes per the Uniform Fire Code, Chapter
label: BODY

text: 80?  (Such processes involve hazardous materials, flammable liquid or flammable
label: BODY

text: gases.)
label: BODY

text: Is a Pre-application Conference required?
label: HH3

text: No, however an applicant may request a pre-application conference.
label: BODY

text: How do I start the application process?
label: HH3

text: The first step is to submit a complete Type I Site Plan Application Form to the Permit
label: BODY

text: Services Center along with the application fees and the required number of copies for
label: BODY

text: all submittal items.  (See the attached Submittal Requirement list)
label: BODY

text: Page 2
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text: Will I ever get to meet with the staff members who review my project?
label: BODY

text: Yes.  When you submit your application, you will be given a date and time for a “Type I
label: BODY

text: Review Conference”.  At this conference you will get to personally meet with your
label: BODY

text: Planner and, depending upon the scope of your project, you may also meet with a staff
label: BODY

text: engineer, a Public Works engineer, a Deputy Fire Marshal, a Sheriff’s Deputy, a
label: BODY

text: Building Inspector or Plans Examiner, or a staff member from the Southwest
label: BODY

text: Washington Health District.
label: BODY

text: As the applicant this conference affords you the opportunity to present your proposal
label: BODY

text: and plans to the staff.  For staff, the conference offers an opportunity to ask questions,
label: BODY

text: give guidance, and to ensure the applicant clearly understands the process and
label: BODY

text: regulations, as they will be affecting them.
label: BODY

text: By the end of the conference, you as the applicant will know whether your project will be
label: BODY

text: approved, approved with conditions, denied, OR, what additional information the staff
label: BODY

text: will need before they can make a decision.  (Your project will be placed on hold if
label: BODY

text: additional information is required.)
label: BODY

text: How does the Type I Site Plan review process work?
label: HH3

text: The County conducts two application checks to ensure that applications are complete
label: BODY

text: before staff begins their development review process.  Prior to accepting an application,
label: BODY

text: the Permit Services staff will conduct a “Counter Complete“ review of the submittal
label: BODY

text: package.
label: BODY

text: This initial Counter Complete review ensures that all required submittal items are
label: BODY

text: contained within the package.  If each item on the submittal requirement list has been
label: BODY

text: submitted, the application will be accepted for further review.  To be Counter Complete,
label: BODY

text: the following items must be submitted:
label: BODY

text: Cover Sheet & Table of Contents
label: BODY

text: Application Form
label: BODY

text: Application Fee
label: BODY

text: Developer’s GIS Packet Information
label: BODY

text: Narrative
label: BODY

text: Authorization to use Site & Support Structure
label: BODY

text: Legal Lot Determination Information
label: BODY

text: Proposed Site Plan
label: BODY

text: 9.    Photographic Analysis
label: BODY

text: 10. Preliminary Stormwater Design Report
label: BODY

text: 11. Associated Applications
label: BODY

text: 12. Submittal Copies
label: BODY

text: Upon acceptance of the application two things will happen immediately.  First, the
label: BODY

text: counter person will schedule a Type I Conference for you.  This conference will be held
label: BODY

text: within 14 to 20 days from the date your application is counter complete.  Second, the
label: BODY

text: counter staff will route the application package (with the conference information) to the
label: BODY

text: review staff.
label: BODY

text: Page 3
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text: Within 21 days (or the 14 to 20 days allotted before the Type I Conference) the review
label: BODY

text: staff will conduct a second completeness check, known as the “Fully Complete“
label: BODY

text: review. This detailed review ensures that all items submitted have the technical
label: BODY

text: information required for staff to make a decision.
label: BODY

text: If the application is “Fully Complete” the staff has until the Type I Conference date to
label: BODY

text: review the application.  The staff is then required to attend the Conference and explain
label: BODY

text: their decision as well as explain any conditions of approval that the applicant may have
label: BODY

text: to complete.  The staff will then have up to 20 days to issue a written decision.
label: BODY

text: If required technical information or items are missing, the planner will prepare a letter
label: BODY

text: indicating the application is “Not Fully Complete”, and deliver it to you at the
label: BODY

text: conference.  It will indicate the additional items and/or information required to make the
label: BODY

text: project “Fully Complete”.  If the requested information is not submitted within 30 days,
label: BODY

text: staff will return the application and refund a portion of the application fee.
label: BODY

text: Once an application is “Fully Complete”, the review staff has 21 days to prepare a
label: BODY

text: written decision that specifies the Conditions of Approval for your project to ensure
label: BODY

text: compliance with all applicable codes and laws.
label: BODY

text: In all, the issuance of a decision may take up to 42 calendar days from the date a
label: BODY

text: counter complete application is accepted by the Permit Services Center, unless it is
label: BODY

text: placed on hold.
label: BODY

text: Can I Request an Extension of Time to Submit Additional Information?
label: HH3

text: Yes.  You can submit a written request to extend the decision deadline and submit
label: BODY

text: additional information for consideration with or after the request.
label: BODY

text: If your application has been deemed “Not Fully Complete” you may also request
label: BODY

text: additional time to submit any information requested.
label: BODY

text: What kind of public notice is provided?
label: HH3

text: There is no public notice required for Type I development proposals.
label: BODY

text: Can the decision be appealed?
label: HH3

text: The staff’s decision may be appealed to the County Hearings Examiner by the applicant
label: BODY

text: or any person or group.  An appellant must submit an appeal application and the $1,166
label: BODY

text: fee within 14 calendar days after the written notice of the decision is mailed.
label: BODY

text: How long is my approval valid?
label: HH3

text: A preliminary site plan approval shall be valid for a period of five (5) years after approval.
label: BODY

text: During that time, a complete application for final site plan review OR building permit must
label: BODY

text: be submitted.  This time limit may be extended where there is an approved phased
label: BODY

text: development or separate development agreements have been approved, (see Clark
label: BODY

text: County Code, Section 40.500.010(B) for more details).
label: BODY

text: After the Preliminary Site Plan is approved, what is next?
label: HH3

text: After receiving approval of the preliminary site plan, the applicant may submit
label: BODY

text: engineering construction plans, the final site plan (if necessary), and building permits for
label: BODY

text: review.
label: BODY

text: Page 4
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text: Note: Conditions of Approval must be met before you begin your project,
label: BODY

text: occupy your building, or open for business.
label: BODY

text: When can I apply for a building permit?
label: HH3

text: Site plan approval is required prior to the issuance of building permits by the Building
label: BODY

text: Division.  However, application for building permits may be made at the same time as
label: BODY

text: application for site plan review.  Please note: Should the site plan review process require
label: BODY

text: modification to the site plan, you must revise and re-submit your building plans to reflect
label: BODY

text: those changes.  Failure to make the appropriate changes may delay your building
label: BODY

text: inspections or it may result in Code Enforcement actions for the failure to comply with the
label: BODY

text: site plan review conditions.  Building permit applications are filed with the Building
label: BODY

text: Division in the Permit Services Center.
label: BODY

text: Please see “Engineering Construction Plan Review” information handout for further
label: BODY

text: information about the final engineering plan and final site plan review process.
label: BODY

text: TYPE I Wireless Communication Collocation
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: $   200 + $75 / lot over 2 lots

text: DEVELOPMENT REVIEW
label: HH1

text: TYPE I SITE PLAN APPLICATION
label: HH1

text: SUBMITTAL REQUIREMENTS
label: HH1

text: The following checklist identifies information required to be included with the Type I Site
label: BODY

text: Plan Application.  All items with a number followed by an underlined space (i.e.,1. ___)
label: BODY

text: must be submitted before the application will be considered “Counter Complete.”  All
label: BODY

text: items with a check box (i.e.,�) must be complete for the application to be determined
label: BODY

text: “Fully Complete.”
label: BODY

text: 1. __  COVER SHEET AND TABLE OF CONTENTS – Each application
label: HH3

text: submittal packet shall contain a cover sheet that includes the applicant’s name,
label: BODY

text: address, e-mail address, and phone number, along with the name of the proposed
label: BODY

text: project.  A table of contents to provide assistance in locating the various
label: BODY

text: requirements shall follow the cover sheet.
label: BODY

text: 2. __  APPLICATION FORM - The application form shall be completed and the
label: HH3

text: applicant shall sign at least one original copy in ink.
label: BODY

text: 3. __  APPLICATION FEE - The fee for a Type I Site Plan review shall accompany
label: BODY

text: the application.  Checks are payable to "Clark County Community Development".
label: BODY

text: 4. __  DEVELOPER’S GIS PACKET INFORMATION
label: HH3

text: A copy of the “Developer’s GIS Packet” shall be submitted with the application.
label: BODY

text: Applicants have the option of requesting their GIS Developer’s Packet in PDF
label: BODY

text: format on a CD or posted to one of our FTP sites. Applicants can request their
label: BODY

text: Developer Packets either as paper copy or electronically for $40.00. Applicants
label: BODY

text: may request the digital version and add a paper copy for an additional $10.65
label: BODY

text: plus tax. The Developer’s Packet fee increase will take effect on September 1,
label: BODY

text: 2007. To order Developer’s Packets, please contact Linda Mattila by phone (360)
label: BODY

text: 397-2391 ext. 4641 or email at themapstore@clark.wa.gov.
label: BODY

text: The packet includes the following:
label: BODY

text: • General Location Map;
label: BODY

text: • Property Information Fact Sheet;
label: BODY

text: • Arterial Roadway, C-Tran Bus Routes, Parks and Trails Map;
label: BODY

text: • Elevation Contours Map;
label: BODY

text: • Photography Map;
label: BODY

text: • Photography Map with Contours;
label: BODY

text: • Zoning Map;
label: BODY

text: • Comprehensive Plan Map;
label: BODY

text: • Water, Sewer and Storm Systems Map;
label: BODY

text: • Soil Type Map;
label: BODY

text: • Environmental Constraints Map; and,
label: BODY

text: • Quarter Section Map.
label: BODY

text: Page 6
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text: 5. __  NARRATIVE
label: HH3

text: A written narrative shall be submitted that addresses the following:
label: BODY

text: COLLOCATIONS:
label: H4

text:  How the application meets or exceeds each of the applicable approval criteria
label: BODY

text: and standards;
label: BODY

text:  How the proposed plan meets the minimum area and dimensions of the base
label: BODY

text: zone;
label: BODY

text:  How the issues identified in the pre-application conference have been
label: BODY

text: addressed, and generally, how services will be provided to the site;
label: BODY

text:  A comprehensive description of the existing or proposed facility including the
label: BODY

text: technical reasons for the design and configuration of the facility, design and
label: BODY

text: dimensional information, and anticipated coverage of the facility;
label: BODY

text:  If camouflage technology is proposed, the applicant shall provide a complete
label: BODY

text: description of the suggested camouflage, including style and materials to be
label: BODY

text: used, a photographic depiction of the proposed facility, and a maintenance plan
label: BODY

text: detailing provisions for the continued effectiveness of the suggested
label: BODY

text: camouflage for the life of the facility;
label: BODY

text:  An analysis of the proposal area and discussion of factors influencing the
label: BODY

text: decision to target the proposed location. Such analysis shall include the good
label: BODY

text: faith efforts and measures taken to secure a higher priority location; how and why
label: BODY

text: such efforts were unsuccessful; and how and why the proposed site is essential
label: BODY

text: to meet service demands for the geographic service area; and,
label: BODY

text:  The frequency of vehicle trips the proposal could be expected to generate.
label: BODY

text: 6.__ AUTHORIZATION TO USE SITE & SUPPORT STRUCTURE
label: HH3

text: Documentation that establishes the applicant’s right to use the site shall be
label: BODY

text: provided at the time of application by a copy of the proposed lease agreement,
label: BODY

text: easement agreement, license agreement or letter of authorization to use the
label: BODY

text: facility from the owner of the support structure.
label: BODY

text: 7.__ LEGAL LOT DETERMINATION INFORMATION
label: HH2

text: If the lot is part of a plat, binding site plan, or subdivision, no lot information is
label: BODY

text: required beyond that supplied in the GIS packet.  If the application is not part of a
label: BODY

text: plat, binding site plan, or subdivision, the applicant is required to either: a)
label: BODY

text: complete a legal lot determination, or b) submit a sales or transfer deed history
label: BODY

text: dating back to 1969, to include copies of recorded deeds and/or contracts verifying
label: BODY

text: the date of creation of the parcel in chronological order with each deed identified
label: BODY

text: with the Assessor’s lot number.
label: BODY

text: 8. __ PROPOSED SITE PLAN
label: HH3

text:  The proposed plan shall be drawn to a minimum engineer’s scale of 1” = 200’
label: BODY

text: on a sheet no larger than 24" x 36".
label: BODY

text: The following information shall be clearly depicted on the proposed site plan:
label: BODY

text: GENERAL INFORMATION
label: H4

text:  Applicant’s name, mailing address and phone number;
label: BODY

text: Page 7
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text:  Owner’s name and mailing address;
label: BODY

text:  Contact person’s name, mailing address, and phone number;
label: BODY

text:  North arrow (orientated to the top, left or right of page) scale and date;
label: BODY

text:  Proposed name of project;
label: BODY

text:  Vicinity map covering ¼ mile radius from the development site (not required for
label: BODY

text: rural area plans); and,
label: BODY

text:  Area of the site in acres or square feet.
label: BODY

text: COLLOCATIONS:
label: H4

text: Existing Conditions
label: BODY

text:  Show the entire parcel, drawn to scale, with property lines, north arrow
label: BODY

text: (orientated to the top, left or right), footprint of existing structures and
label: BODY

text: driveways, parking spaces, abutting streets (name, centerline, curb &
label: BODY

text: sidewalk), and existing fire hydrants;
label: BODY

text:  The location of existing wells & septic systems;
label: BODY

text:  Location and full width of existing easements for access, drainage , utilities,
label: BODY

text: etc.;
label: BODY

text:  The locations of any existing environmentally sensitive areas (e.g. wetlands,
label: BODY

text: water bodies, steep slopes etc.) on the site, as indicated in the GIS materials;
label: BODY

text:  Indicate the existing surfacing and features on all portions of the site, such as
label: BODY

text: asphalt, landscaping, lawn, gravel, stormwater swale, etc; (as applicable); and,
label: BODY

text:  Elevation plans showing the existing antennae and the height of each as well
label: BODY

text: as any lightning rods (as applicable).
label: BODY

text: Proposed Improvements
label: BODY

text:  Show the location of all proposed structures, driveways and roads, easements.
label: BODY

text: number and layout of proposed parking spaces; (as applicable) and proposed
label: BODY

text: location of fire hydrants;;
label: BODY

text:  Landscape plan if landscaping is proposed; and,
label: BODY

text:  Elevation plans of proposed site and facility changes.
label: BODY

text: 9. __ PHOTOGRAPHIC ANALYSIS
label: HH3

text: A photographic analysis of the proposed site shall be submitted, including a
label: BODY

text: representation of existing conditions and photographic simulations depicting
label: BODY

text: views of any new antennae, support structures or towers.
label: BODY

text: 10.__PRELIMINARY STORMWATER DESIGN REPORT
label: HH2

text: If the project involves the addition or re-development of 2,000-sq. ft. of
label: BODY

text: impervious surfacing in an Urban Growth Area or 5,000-sq. ft. of impervious
label: BODY

text: surfacing outside of an Urban Growth Area, stormwater review will be required
label: BODY

text: for the project.
label: BODY

text: 11.__ASSOCIATED APPLICATIONS
label: HH3

text: Applications associated with the project, to the extent applicable (e.g., floodplain,
label: BODY

text: habitat, shoreline, wetland, variances, etc.) must be submitted prior to or with this
label: BODY

text: application.
label: BODY

text: Page 8
label: BODY

text: Handout #74-C
label: BODY

text: 12.__SUBMITTAL COPIES
label: HH3

text: The applicant must select Option A or B below and proceed as follows:
label: BODY

text: Option A:
label: BODY

text: Submit a CD in PDF format, with a paper copy of the full application package.
label: BODY

text: Any special studies shall also be included on the CD. The proposed plans
label: BODY

text: submitted must be scanned to an engineer's scale. The main CD application
label: BODY

text: shall be organized as follows:
label: BODY

text: The application submittal shall be organized in the same order as the table
label: BODY

text: of contents, with a separate PDF document for each separate item.
label: BODY

text: The PDF document must be organized into separate files. Each PDF file
label: BODY

text: must be labeled with a number followed by a name (example):
label: BODY

text: 1. Cover Sheet and Table of Contents
label: BODY

text: 2. Application Form
label: BODY

text: 3. Developer’s GIS Packet Information
label: BODY

text: 4. etc.
label: BODY

text: Option B:
label: BODY

text: ___ One copy of the main submittal with original signatures, bound by a
label: BODY

text: Jumbo clip or rubber band, and
label: BODY

text: ___ Five (5) copies of application package with a full size set of plans.
label: BODY

text: ___ Separately bound copy of any special studies (e.g., wetland,
label: BODY

text: floodplain, etc) as identified below:
label: BODY

text:  1 original and 3 copies - Traffic Study and Road Modification requests
label: BODY

text:  1 original and 2 copies of all other special studies or permits to include:
label: BODY

text: Critical Aquifer Recharge Areas (CARA) floodplain, geo-hazard, habitat,
label: BODY

text: shoreline, stormwater, erosion control plan, and wetland).
label: BODY

text: ___2 reduced copies of 11” x 17" for all sheets larger than 11” x 17.”
label: BODY

text: Staff Notes:
label: HH3

text: 1. If any of the application materials exceed 11” x 17" in size, please also provide a
label: BODY

text: reduced copy no larger than 11” x 17”.  Clark County cannot reproduce materials
label: BODY

text: larger than 11” x 17".
label: BODY

text: This application was determined to be Counter Complete on: ____/______/____
label: HH3

text: Community Development Specialist: _______________________________
label: HH3

text: * This fee is not required if a previous legal review has been comnpleted.
